After the save but before the HCR failed notification I hit Resume.

We should disable resume/step etc while an HCR is in progress.

The HCR manager should deletgate to the target to perform the hotswap, this way 
it can update its "enabled" state.

The HCR code was pulled out of the target because the JDIDebugTarget class
was (still is?) huge and bloated. I'd prefer to have the HCR manager to do
the updating or, if necessary, tell the target to update itself.

Fixed. Added an isPerformingHotCodeReplace() method to IJavaDebugTarget which
is checked in the methods that enable stepping and resuming for java debug
elements.

I'm not able to test the problem on my machine (it's too fast and I'm having
technical difficulties unrelated to this bug). One possible issue is that I
didn't add code to fire a changed event when the performingHCR status changes.
